summary: This is an email from Deutsche Bank's litigation counsel, Justin Alfano, providing transaction charts from Deutsche Bank's document production related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial activities. The charts detail millions of dollars in transactions involving Epstein, his entities, and high-profile individuals and funds like Leon Black, the Rothschild Group, and various hedge funds.

persons.name: Justin Alfano
persons.role: Director / Associate General Counsel, Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch
persons.context: Sender of the email providing Deutsche Bank's transaction charts to prosecutors/investigators. He is the point of contact for the bank's litigation and regulatory enforcement.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding Deutsche Bank's transaction production. Likely a prosecutor or investigator.

persons.name: Erika Engelson
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding Deutsche Bank's transaction production. Likely a prosecutor or investigator.

persons.name: Vijay Dewan
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding Deutsche Bank's transaction production. Likely a prosecutor or investigator.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Listed in multiple multi-million dollar transactions from his and his family's entities to Southern Trust Company, Inc., an Epstein-linked entity. A footnote states Bloomberg reported he controls BV70 LLC.

persons.name: Debra Black
persons.context: Listed alongside Leon Black in multiple multi-million dollar transactions to Southern Trust Company, Inc.

persons.name: Benjamin Edmond de Rothschild
persons.context: Listed in a transaction where $14,999,980 was sent from him to Southern Trust Company, Inc. in December 2015.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the financial investigation. Transactions show capital flows into his accounts (Jeepers Inc., The Haze Trust, personal accounts) from various sources and payments to individuals and entities.

persons.name: Barry Jay Josephson
persons.context: Received $200,000 from Jeepers Inc. (Epstein's DB Brokerage Account) in November 2013.

persons.name: Adam Bly
persons.context: Received multiple payments ranging from $3,000 to $100,000 from Jeepers Inc. and Southern Financial LLC between 2014 and 2015.

persons.name: Michelle Saipher
persons.context: Listed with Darren Indyke as receiving two payments totaling $1,223,000 from Jeepers Inc. in 2014.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Listed with Michelle Saipher as receiving two payments totaling $1,223,000 from Jeepers Inc. in 2014.

persons.name: Gol Muchnik
persons.context: Received $500,000 from Jeepers Inc. in April 2016.

persons.name: Sultan Bin Sulayem
persons.context: Received $6,200 from Jeepers Inc. in July 2017.

persons.name: Jamie Mitchell
persons.context: Received $100,000 from Jeepers Inc. in October 2017.

persons.name: David J Mitchell
persons.context: Received numerous payments from Jeepers Inc. between 2017 and 2019, totaling hundreds of thousands of dollars.

persons.name: Joichi Ito
persons.context: Engaged in multiple transactions with Southern Financial LLC, both receiving and sending funds, totaling over $1.4 million between 2014 and 2015.

persons.name: Bruce Moskowitz
persons.context: The 'Bruce and Marsha Moskowitz Foundation' is listed as a recipient of multiple $50,000 payments from the Gratitude America MMDA account.

persons.name: Marsha Moskowitz
persons.context: The 'Bruce and Marsha Moskowitz Foundation' is listed as a recipient of multiple $50,000 payments from the Gratitude America MMDA account.

connections.description: Financial transactions show millions flowing from Leon Black, Debra Black, and their entities (Black Family Partners, BV70 LLC) to Epstein-linked entities (Southern Trust Company, Inc., Gratitude America Ltd.). A footnote cites a Bloomberg report that Black controls BV70 LLC.
A transaction shows $14,999,980 sent from Benjamin Edmond de Rothschild to Southern Trust Company, Inc., an Epstein-linked entity.
Alfano, Deutsche Bank's counsel, is corresponding with Stemmer (and others), providing transaction charts as part of a legal/investigative production.
Alfano, Deutsche Bank's counsel, is corresponding with Engelson (and others), providing transaction charts as part of a legal/investigative production.
Alfano, Deutsche Bank's counsel, is corresponding with Dewan (and others), providing transaction charts as part of a legal/investigative production.
Multiple transactions show funds moving between Southern Financial LLC (an Epstein entity) and Joichi Ito.

events.title: Leon Black Initial Transaction
events.description: Leon and Debra Black send $8,500,000 to Southern Trust Company, Inc., marking the first recorded transaction in the Leon Black/Rothschild chart.

events.title: BV70 LLC Funds Gratitude America
events.description: BV70 LLC sends $10,000,000 to Gratitude America, Ltd. A footnote states this account was primarily capitalized by this deposit and that Bloomberg reported Leon Black controls BV70 LLC.

events.title: Bloomberg Article Published
events.description: Bloomberg publishes an article titled "Jeffrey Epstein's Endgame: One Last Shot to Stay in Wall Street's Favor," which is cited in a footnote linking Leon Black to BV70 LLC.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank produced detailed transaction charts showing millions of dollars flowing between Jeffrey Epstein's entities (Southern Trust Company, Inc., Southern Financial LLC, Jeepers Inc., The Haze Trust, Gratitude America) and high-profile individuals/funds.
Leon Black and his related entities (including Black Family Partners and BV70 LLC) are shown to have sent tens of millions of dollars to Epstein-linked entities between 2013 and 2018.

The financial records show Epstein's accounts were used to make numerous payments to individuals including Adam Bly, David J. Mitchell, lawyers (Stone & Magnanini, Kellerhals Ferguson Kroblin), and charities (Melanoma Research Alliance).
A footnote references a Bloomberg report from August 6, 2019, stating that Leon Black controls BV70 LLC, which sent $10 million to Epstein's Gratitude America entity.
The document is an email from Deutsche Bank's litigation counsel to prosecutors/investigators, indicating an active financial investigation into Epstein's network.
